oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of two Texas airfields, a plane landed in Mansfield, Louisiana. Nashville Banner, 1927 July 31.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Andrews, W. V.
Nashville Banner
Airplanes; Air pilots; Aerial photographs
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of Kelly and Brooks fields in San Antonio, Texas, and a plane landed in Mansfield, Louisiana. The photos are made by a Nashville photographer with the105 Observation Squadron of the Tennessee National Guard. Also shown is a flight simulation machine called an orientator used for training pilots. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: U. S. Army Air Corps.; Barr, W. E.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
